topic.title: [WikiLeaks] Assange possibly in trouble and /r/WikiLeaks has been potentially taken over.
topic.body:
Some scary shit is going on.

https://archive.fo/qq6MK

4_1BFTNXtYQDMCurqyg45KLmsV6oJD7bQSsH.body: Sure, let's bring the bad parts of the clearnet onto here.

> [silverstorm](#comment_21_1BFTNXtYQDMCurqyg45KLmsV6oJD7bQSsH): Wondering how some people can be so idiot to not understand the difference between "rating" and "censorship" and the fact that you cannot never see any activity where you need to know the reliability, and scammers are a problem. Too much stupid kiddy here.

Rating individuals != censorship but can certainly lead to it. 

I don't care if sites run their own "reputation" based off of users and even if other sites only allow users of a certain "reputation" from particular sites they choose. 

This is already doable as a site creator. However If you want something like that why not just go back to facebook on the clearnet? It's what "likes" basically are. 

The censorship would be very prevalent if it was built into the protocol that you couldn't access content that was downrated by enough people. This would be ripe for abuse by state actors, big companies, and ideologues of all stripes.
